title: Re: Question...
content:
Change the actual sound or switch them around?

To switch them, there's patches.

To change them, there's a program for it (not sure where to get it)-Genius314

title: Re: Question...
content:
Hehe, I was going to write a link to my own sound editing program, but then I remembered that
1. I never released it (never finished it to releasing state)
2. it got deleted along with my other projects in last December. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]
Spleen's sound editor can be found here:
[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/keen/spleen/archive/keenfx.zip]jimsoft.spatang.com/keen/...keenfx.zip[/url]You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Question...
content:
The patch index also lists [under S for sounds] the patches needed to switch any sound in Keen 2 or 3 with any other sound. [This can be useful as currently Spleens program can't change Keen 2 & 3 sounds.]A proud member of the signature stealing society
